p: From the stems of Hyptidendron canum (Pohl. ex Benth.) R. Harley, a series of triterpenes were isolated. The compounds were identified as betulinic acid ( 74), β-sitosterol ( 77), ursolic acid ( 78), sitosterol- β-D-glucoside ( 80), α-amyrin ( 82), β-amyrin ( 83), maslinic acid ( 87), stigmasterol ( 93), 2 α-3 β-dihydroxyursolic acid ( 100), eucasphic acid ( 101), uvaol ( 102) and eritrodiol ( 103) ( Lemes et al., 2011). The species Marsypianthes chamaedrys (Vahl.) Kuntze biosynthesizes several triterpenes, such as the novel compound chamaedrydiol ( 104), and the known ones α-amyrin ( 82), β-amyrin ( 83), lup-29(29)-ene-2α-3β-diol ( 105), castanopsol ( 106), epigermanidiol ( 107), lupeol ( 108) and germanicol ( 109) ( de Sousa Menezes et al., 1998).
